title: GIUSTO | translate Italian to English - Cambridge Dictionary
text: Translation of giusto – Italian–English dictionary giusto adverb Synonym (Translation of giusto from the GLOBAL Italian–English Dictionary © 2018 K Dictionaries Ltd) Translation of giusto | PASSWORD Italian–English Dictionary giusto adjective done [adjective] socially accepted correct [adjective] right; not wrong fair [adjective] just; not favouring/favoring one side just [adjective] right and fair, not favouring/favoring one more than another just [adjective] reasonable; based on one’s rights just [adjective] deserved proper [adjective] right, correct, or suitable right [adjective] correct right [adjective] morally correct; good right [adjective] suitable; appropriate righteous [adjective] (of anger etc) justifiable square [adjective] (of business dealings, scores in games etc) level, even, fairly balanced etc (Translation of giusto from the PASSWORD Italian–English Dictionary © 2014 K Dictionaries Ltd)
